Since his arrival, the 23-year-old frontman has claimed seven goals to spark talk [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: THE legendary Jock Stein masterminded Celtic to his tenth title success 47 years ago today. It was also his final championship after kicking off the historic procession of nine consecutive triumphs by guiding the Hoops to a 1-0 win over Motherwell at Fir Park in May 1966. An identical scoreline against Hibs at Easter Road [...]
articles.title: TEN AND OUT: BIG JOCK’S LAST HURRAH

There was no semblance of the traditional handshake with the opposition manager as the Belgian peevishly ignored Don Cowie while displaying [...]

articles.description: Anyone can win when you are miles ahead and there is no pressure on, but winning when you can feel an opponent’s breath on your neck is far more challenging.  Celtic dealt admirably with the pressure on Saturday. If anything, the wind was worse than at Ibrox six days earlier.  Playing against the breeze in [...]

articles.description:
Issue 132 of the fanzine is now available to buy in print and digital format. Inside the latest issue Celtic fans Stateside are getting excited about Celtic’s return to North America, we look ahead to the tour. We are now at the business end of the season and we look at this season’s up and […]
The post ISSUE 132 ON SALE NOW appeared first on Celtic Fanzine.
articles.title: ISSUE 132 ON SALE NOW

articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
Everyone here at More than 90 Minutes would like to offer our sincere condolences to the family and friends of fellow St. Margaret’s CSC season book holder, Alison McGoff who tragically died suddenly at Celtic Park on Saturday before Celtic v St. Mirren. We found out about her sad passing after the final whistle on […]
The post YNWA Tributes to Alison appeared first on Celtic Fanzine.
articles.title: YNWA Tributes to Alison
